job.title: Senior Software Engineer (Full Stack)
job.description:
MedMe Health builds software for pharmacists to deliver paid clinical services like prescribing/adapting medications, point-of-care testing, giving vaccinations, and monitoring chronic conditions.

Our web-based platform helps both independent pharmacies and large chains schedule appointments online, conduct virtual care, automate documentation, and flag clinical opportunities. With MedMe, our customers have increased their efficiency of clinical service delivery by 10x and increased pharmacy revenue with the same staff.

For the first time, MedMe enables integrations to traditionally locally-stored pharmacy data. Our vision is to transform today’s dispensing locations to tomorrow’s health hubs.

I’m excited to apply for the Business Analyst role at MedMe Health, where my data-driven approach and experience optimizing operational workflows align with your mission to transform pharmacies into health hubs. At BigBasket, I leveraged analytics to improve on-time grocery delivery by 85% and drove 5% monthly revenue growth—skills directly transferable to enhancing efficiency in clinical service delivery.  

My background in applied modeling and big data (M.Sc., Trent University) equips me to extract actionable insights from complex datasets, much like the integrations you’re pioneering with pharmacy data. At Cognizant, I collaborated cross-functionally to test and refine a pet retail app, ensuring seamless functionality—a mindset I’d bring to optimizing your web-based platform for pharmacists.  

What excites me most is MedMe’s focus on scaling impact without scaling staff. job.title: Senior Technical Drafter
job.description:
DraftAid is the world's first generative AI for CAD manufacturing drawings, akin to GitHub Copilot but for CAD. It drastically shortens drawing creation time, turning hours into seconds.  

Every product that is manufactured - from construction to aerospace, automotive, durable goods, and electronics—relies on drawings. Currently, engineers and designers painstakingly make these essential drawings manually. Draftaid streamlines this process saving teams millions in time and quality.  

Using DraftAid, teams can automate this process with a single click and:  
- Save considerable time  
- Direct their focus toward more value-added tasks  
- Cut down on drawing errors, preventing expensive manufacturing mistakes  

The problem:  
Modern design teams initiate their design by 3D modeling. To get their design manufactured, they need to make 2D drawings. Making 2D drawings for what’s already been modeled in 3D takes up considerable time and energy. Design teams find themselves stuck investing 40% of their time in this manual task.  

DraftAid streamlines the drafting process making it as effortless as a single click. Once engineers complete their 3D design, a single click swiftly produces a manufacturing-ready 2D drawing within seconds. The resulting drawing is entirely editable, allowing engineers to make adjustments before sending it off for manufacturing.  

DraftAid allows teams to slash their current drawing time by up to 90% and eliminate common drawing errors. This enhances efficiency and ensures consistency in drawings throughout the company.

cover_letter:
**Yugant Soni**  
206 Steward St, Peterborough  
+1 (437) 566-6408 | yugantsoni99@gmail.com  

**Hiring Team,**  
DraftAid  

Dear Hiring Team,  

I’m excited to apply for the Business Analyst role at DraftAid, where cutting-edge AI meets CAD manufacturing—a perfect fit for my passion for data-driven efficiency and process optimization. Your mission to automate 2D drafting aligns with my experience in leveraging analytics to drive measurable improvements, such as achieving an 85% on-time delivery rate at BigBasket by refining logistics workflows.  

At BigBasket, I analyzed sales trends to sustain 5% monthly growth and mentored teams to operationalize data-driven decisions—skills I’d apply to help DraftAid’s users maximize time savings and error reduction. My background in Python, SQL, and AWS QuickSight, combined with experience developing a 92%-accurate self-driving car prototype using CNNs, reflects my ability to bridge technical and operational gaps in AI-driven tools.  

I’d welcome the chance to discuss how my analytical rigor and enthusiasm for AI-powered efficiency can contribute to DraftAid’s mission. Let’s connect at your earliest convenience.  

Best regards,  
**Yugant Soni**

job.title: Senior Backend Engineer
job.description:
AviaryAI is the industry's first outbound AI service team for banks, credit unions, and insurance companies. In a landscape where only 18% of financial service providers make proactive outbound calls and rely heavily on emails, AviaryAI offers a groundbreaking solution. Powered by a private LLM, our suite of products helps institutions leverage Generative AI while adhering to stringent regulatory and compliance standards.  

The problem  

- Limited Outbound Calls: Only 18% of banks, credit unions, and insurance companies make outbound calls, missing crucial engagement opportunities throughout the customer lifecycle.  
- Inefficiency and Missed Opportunities: Internal employees, often untrained or unmotivated, handle outbound calls which leads to incomplete interactions and lost revenue.  
- Challenges with GenAI Adoption: Financial institutions hesitate to use general-purpose models like ChatGPT due to their lack of transparency and regulatory compliance concerns.  
- Complex Interactions: Automating post-call workflows (e.g., opening new accounts, activating cards) is challenging due to the need for multiple systems to work together seamlessly.  

Our Impact  

- Proven Success Rate: 26% of our AI-driven calls have resulted in successful customer interactions, significantly boosting engagement and revenue for our clients.  
- High Interaction Rate: 72% of all answered calls have an interaction with our voice agents beyond a simple “hello”.  

Why Now?  

In the face of financial and regulatory pressures, banks, credit unions, and insurance companies are hesitant to adopt new technologies due to compliance fears. AviaryAI addresses this by offering a vertical-specific LLM, fine-tuned with industry data to tackle the unique challenges of financial services.  

Jobs at AviaryAI  

Full Stack Software Engineer  
New York, NY, US  
$75K - $85K  
0.10% - 0.30%  
Any (New Grads Ok)

Dear Hiring Team,

Your mission to bridge the gap in outbound AI solutions for financial services resonates with my passion for leveraging data and technology to drive efficiency and growth. My background in business analysis and software testing aligns well with the challenges you’re addressing.  

At BigBasket, I optimized delivery processes using data analytics, achieving an 85% on-time delivery rate and 5% monthly revenue growth—demonstrating my ability to translate insights into measurable impact. My experience designing a self-driving car system with CNNs (92% accuracy) reflects my technical aptitude in building scalable AI-driven solutions. During my tenure at Cognizant, I developed test suites for a mobile app, collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless functionality—a skill critical for AviaryAI’s complex post-call workflows.  

With proficiency in Python, Java, and AWS QuickSight—and a relentless focus on problem-solving—I’m confident in my ability to contribute to your vertical-specific LLM. I’d welcome the chance to discuss how my skills can support AviaryAI’s mission.  

Best regards,  
**Yugant Soni**

job.title: Senior Engineer (Platform)
job.description:
Terminal is Plaid for telematics data in commercial trucking. Companies building next generation insurance products, financial services and fleet software for trucking use our Universal API to access GPS data, speeding data and vehicle stats.

😰 Problem  
Our customers include (but are not limited to): insurance companies, fuel cards, invoice factorers, fleet management systems, digital freight brokers, load boards and transportation management systems. These folks need access to telematics data to support their end-users who are trucking companies and commercial fleets. Integrating telematics is often a must-have for them and there’s typically a direct correlation between their number of supported integrations and their sales closure rate.  

The telematics market is fragmented, with hundreds of available platforms, each with their own type of integration (REST, SOAP, etc.), and documentation that is not always available. Companies that need to integrate into these vendors have large integration teams and are still unable to meet their customers' demand.  

🔮 Solution  
Terminal's Universal API for Telematics enables companies to support all of the leading telematics platforms through a single integration. Similar to Plaid and Stripe - our mission is to increase the innovation velocity of transportation, logistics and fleet management through making fleet data more accessible.  

We provide a white-labelled User Interface for fleet managers to grant access to telematics data like GPS, vehicle stats, driver hours and safety events.  

Once a fleet manager grants access, we extract, normalize, enrich, and sync the data for our customer. We also offer common data models, webhooks and access to raw telematics data to make it easy for customers to integrate. You can learn more about how it works in our API Documentation.  

Customers also receive a Support Portal for managing their integrations, customer connections and data syncs.

cover_letter:
**Yugant Soni**  
206 Steward St, Peterborough  
+1 (437) 566-6408 | yugantsoni99@gmail.com  

[Date]  

Hiring Team,  
Terminal  

Dear Hiring Team,  

I’m excited to apply for the Business Analyst role at Terminal, where I can leverage my data-driven problem-solving skills to help streamline telematics integrations for commercial trucking. Your mission to unify fragmented fleet data aligns perfectly with my experience in optimizing processes through analytics.  

At BigBasket, I:  
- **Analyzed complex datasets** to identify sales trends, driving 5% MoM growth—a skill directly applicable to deriving insights from GPS, speeding, and vehicle stats.  
- **Managed cross-functional projects**, ensuring on-time delivery (85% success rate) by coordinating timelines and resources—critical for supporting API integrations and customer portals.  
- **Trained teams** on data-driven decision-making, which would translate well to helping customers navigate Terminal’s Support Portal.  

My technical background (Python, SQL, AWS QuickSight) and experience building a self-driving car model (92% accuracy using CNNs) reflect my ability to work with sensor data and scalable systems—key for normalizing telematics data.  

I’d welcome the chance to discuss how my analytical rigor and passion for simplifying complex data can contribute to Terminal’s vision. Let’s connect.  

Best regards,  
**Yugant Soni**
